titleStmt.title: A short view of the late troubles in England briefly setting forth, their rise, growth, and tragical conclusion, as also, some parallel thereof with the barons-wars in the time of King Henry III : but chiefly with that in France, called the Holy League, in the reign of Henry III and Henry IV, late kings of the realm : to which is added a perfect narrative of the Treaty at U[n]bridge in an.
titleStmt.author: Dugdale, William, Sir, 1605-1686.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed at the Theater for Moses Pitt ...,

notesStmt.note: Published anonymously. Reissued the same year under the name of Sir William Dugdale.

"The hiatusses in the above collation gave rise to the conjecture that the licenser had curtailed this work, but on comparing the printed book with the original manuscript, this supposition was found to be erroneous." Cf. Lowndes.
"A full relation of the passages concerning the treaty for a peace, begun at U[n]bridge, January 30, 1644" (p. 733-959) is a reprint of a pamphlet printed at Oxford in 1645. Cf. DNB and BM
Imperfect: "A full relation of the passages concerning the treaty" are lacking on film.
Reproduction of original in Bristol Public Library.
